Description: Describes biological sex as recorded in the patient's identity document or in the hospital record. In the absence of documentation, the one declared by the patient will be recorded
Describes race as recorded in  the hospital record, the one declared by the patient,, otherwise, the onerecognized by the observer
Year of birth of the patient.
Country of residence at the time of diagnosis
Describes tobacco smoker habits within the options proposed
Calculates pack/ year by multiplying the number of packs of cigarettes smoked per day by the number of years the person has been smoking.
Describes alcohol habits within the options proposed
Provides the Charlson Comorbidity index for the patient
If no genetic syndrome was identified for the patient. based on WHO 2020.
If patient presents Olliers disease
If patient presents Maffuci syndrome
If patient presents Li-Fraumeni syndrome
If patient presents McCune-Albright syndrome
If patient presents Multiple osteochondromas
If patient presents Neurofibromatosis type 1
If patient presents Rothmund-Thomson syndrome
If patient presents Werner syndrome
If patient presents Retinoblastoma
If patient presents Paget disease
If patient presents Other Genetic syndrome. According to WHO 2020

Describes the site of the malignant tumour reported or assesed before the cancer under study. Any type of of solid and haematological cancer is listed. To obtain the previous malignant cancer refer to the solid tumor (metastatic and non-metastatic)  comorbidity
Describes the type of treatment performed for the previous cancer
Patient element
Describes the status at last follow-up

Describes the disease status at the last follow-up. This value is redundant as it could be derived from the disease status in EpisodeEvent. If a Patient has 3 follow-ups, but the disease status (e.g., stable disease) did not change during those, the follow-ups will be grouped into a single one with the last date of the three of them.
Date of the clinical follow-up
Date of the last contact with the patient, of any kind.
Patient element containing the data regarding the patient followed by the hospital
Date when the cancer was detected. Must match the date of the first diagnosis. It works as the "overarching" episode
CancerEpisode reference where the diagnosis was performed
Date of the procedure performed to obtain the specimen for the histological diagnosis, regardless of the institution that performed it.
Type of biopsy performed to the patient. Information coming from the biopsy data.
Describes the institution where diagnostic procedure was performed. A pseudonym for a hospital. It could be the ID assigned from the original hospital.
Age of the patient at the time of the diagnosis.
radiotherapy induced if the new tumour is in the field or marginal  the anatomical area that received high radiation dose; please specify the interval time from the radiotherapy treatment
Grading of the cancer given by the biopsy
HNC: Describes the histology of primary tumour according to WHO 2017 clasification.
Describes the primary tumor site. For head and neck, according to AJCC .
Histology subgroup value for the cancer diagnosis.
Topography subsite value for the cancer diagnosis
Histology/Topography code combination for the cancer diagnosis
Describes the tumor size in CM. (the longest diameter; longest dimension between pre operatory imaging and pathological specimen) cm

Provides the superficial depth of the tumour (for upper and lower limbs and superficial trunk)  superficial (superficial tumour is located exclusively above the investing fascia without invasion of the fascia), deep (deep tumour is located beneath or invade the investing fascia). All the others are deep by definition.

Provides the deep depth of the tumour (for upper and lower limbs and superficial trunk)  superficial (superficial tumour is located exclusively above the investing fascia without invasion of the fascia), deep (deep tumour is located beneath or invade the investing fascia). All the others are deep by definition
Mitotic count reported from the biopsy (Number/10HPF/1mm2, 50HPF/5mm2). Reported as Number of mitoses per 10 high power fields.
Mitotic index derived from the mitotic count. Information coming from the biopsy and derived. M1 for less than 10HPF, M2 for range 10-20 HPF and M3 for greater than 20 HPF.
CancerEpisode element containing the data regarding the patient's cancer
Update to the disease status
Whether or not the progression/recurrence or persistent disease  was performed at the registering hospital or another hospital.
Start date of progression/recurrence or persistent disease
Diagnosis reference in case the treatment was done for baseline
EpisodeEvent element containing the data regarding the patient's cancer, in case the treatment was done for an episode event (progression, recurrence...)
Primary surgery/re-excision (check with unplanned or excisional biopsy)
Date of the surgery for primary tumor with or without neck surgery

Palliative: surgery performed with the intent of improving quality of life or relieving symptoms caused by advanced disease.
Curative: surgery performed with the intend of oncologic cure, regardless of its result (R0 / R1/R2)

The R0 (“no residual rumor”) category applies only to cases in which residual tumor cannot be detected by conventional diagnostic methods. A more exact definition would read “no detectable residual tumor.”This category corresponds to surgical resection for cure.
The R1 category is reserved exclusively for cases in which residual tumor is found by histologic examination. This category may apply to biopsy sampling of the regional tissue at the site of resection or of a distant site at the time of surgery. It also applies to microscopic examination of the resection margins of the surgical resection specimen by the pathologist.
R2 applies to cases with macroscopically visible residual tumor that is detected either clinically or pathologically.
Tumor rupture Yes/No
Surgical specimen Mitotic count
Provides the grading for surgical specimen only for untreated tumours
